reviews.review: You should already own this it came out 16 years ago

An absolute classic! if you can get it cheaply I would recommend it to everyone. 
The graphics are no longer the best, but have aged well. 
In terms of gameplay, it's absolutely great.
me parece mejor que el half life

Portal is an awesome game for everyone to try at least once in their life. I already had it on another platform but as i hadn't played in a while, i decided to purchase it on here too. Its a great puzzle/challenge game which is not hard but it will get them brain cogs turning on occasion. GG.
Juego cortito de puzles cuya historia es bastante buena. Barato sencillo y poco exigente para equipos viejos p√≠llatelo y dale una oportunidad

" The most interesting games start with a mystery. 
You are in the middle of the puzzle as the main character and the more you go forward, the more interesting and imaginative it becomes. Such is this game, Portal. Built on the Half Life platform, this game brings new rules of physics and science, a weapon that opens up many fields and the mind itself. As you break the laws of physics, space and time by moving in a limited parameter, you realize that the so-called simple tests are not just so simple at first glance. I have enjoyed this game for a very long time, and now via Steam and some time off (finally) I have a chance to continue my enjoyment in sequel, Portal 2." - [«§∆é≈ä«§]

AMAZING gameplay! Will strike you as a simple puzzle game at first, but then it just hits you at the end. Absolutely recommend to those who want to get into gaming, but aren't sure where to start! DEFINITELY start with Portal! One of the best out there.

To be fair, you have to have a very high IQ to understand Rick and Morty. The humour is extremely subtle, and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the jokes will go over a typical viewer's head. There's also Rick's nihilistic outlook, which is deftly woven into his characterisation- his personal philosophy draws heavily from Narodnaya Volya literature, for instance. The fans understand this stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of these jokes, to realise that they're not just funny- they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike Rick & Morty truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldn't appreciate, for instance, the humour in Rick's existential catchphrase "Wubba Lubba Dub Dub," which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenev's Russian epic Fathers and Sons. I'm smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Dan Harmon's genius wit unfolds itself on their television screens. What fools.. how I pity them. üòÇ

And yes, by the way, i DO have a Rick & Morty tattoo. And no, you cannot see it. It's for the ladies' eyes only- and even then they have to demonstrate that they're within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand. Nothin personnel kid üòé
Absolute masterpiece of a physics puzzle solver. Not much more to say
This game is really fun the story is a bit short but this was made 14 years ago but it aged so well. The story is amazing even if it is lacking a bit. Would recommend to people.

It was a cool experience, took me only three hours to finish the story, it also has challenges you can beat, in advanced difficulty or with challenges, overall it's a good game and it's worth trying
